subject: [Announce] JUnit-addons on SourceForge
msgSnippet: I m pleased to announce a new project on SourceForge:  JUnit-addons ( ) The goal of this project is to offer utility
messageBody:
I'm pleased to announce a new project on SourceForge: JUnit-addons
(<http://junit-addons.sourceforge.net>)

The goal of this project is to offer utility classes to be used with JUnit.

This release features:
- assertNotEquals methods
- assertFalse and assertNotSame methods for those still using JUnit 3.7
- XMLPropertyManager and PropertyManager to group all the properties you
used to pass to JUnit via -D options
- a class validator to see if you don't have typos in your tests (ever
searched why your 'setup' wasn't executed?) It's available as a
standalone program or as an Ant task.

If you have developed classes and would like to publish them, simply
post them to the JUnit-addons website
(<http://sourceforge.net/projects/junit-addons>) and we will be glad to
add them into the next release.

The current release (version 3.7.1) can (of course) be used with JUnit
3.8 but I will maintain this version until the 3.8 is widely used.

For discussion about the project, please go to the JUnit-addons website.

I hope you'll find this project helpful.

-Vladimir

--
Vladimir Bossicard
www.bossicard.com
